title: 106_s1189
content: The "Microcap Fraud Prevention Act of 1999" is cited as the short title for this Act. Amendments to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 are included in this legislation. Section 15(b)(4) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to include provisions related to orders of the Commission barring or suspending association with a broker or dealer, and requirements to disclose material facts in applications, reports, or proceedings related to securities, banking, or insurance. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to include provisions related to orders of the Commission barring or suspending association with a broker or dealer, and requirements to disclose material facts in applications, reports, or proceedings related to securities, banking, insurance, and state securities commissions. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to include provisions related to orders of the Commission barring or suspending association with a broker or dealer, and requirements to disclose material facts in applications, reports, or proceedings related to securities, banking, insurance, and state securities commissions. The amendment allows for the barring of individuals from engaging in the business of securities, insurance, or banking based on violations of laws prohibiting fraudulent, manipulative, or deceptive conduct. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS TO THE INVESTMENT ADVISERS ACT OF 1940. Section 203 of the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 is amended to include provisions related to orders of the Commission and findings by foreign financial regulatory authorities regarding false or misleading statements. The Investment Advisers Act of 1940 is amended to include provisions related to false or misleading statements made to foreign financial regulatory authorities regarding securities, banking, insurance, or commodity trading regulations. The Investment Advisers Act of 1940 is amended to include provisions related to false or misleading statements made to foreign financial regulatory authorities regarding securities, banking, insurance, or commodity trading regulations. It also addresses violations of statutes or regulations by individuals under supervision, and orders from state or federal regulatory bodies restricting investment advisers or persons. The Investment Advisers Act of 1940 is amended to include provisions related to false or misleading statements made to foreign financial regulatory authorities regarding securities, banking, insurance, or commodity trading regulations. It also addresses violations of statutes or regulations by individuals under supervision, and orders from state or federal regulatory bodies restricting investment advisers or persons from association with regulated entities or engaging in securities, insurance, or banking business. SEC. 4. AMENDMENTS TO THE INVESTMENT COMPANY ACT OF 1940. Section 9(b) of the Investment Company Act of 1940 is amended to include provisions regarding false or misleading statements in applications or reports filed with foreign financial regulatory authorities. The amendment includes provisions related to violations of foreign statutes or regulations regarding securities, banking, insurance, or contracts of sale of a commodity for future delivery traded on contract markets or boards of trade. The curr_chunk discusses the conditions under which a person may be barred from association with regulated entities or engaging in financial activities based on violations of laws or regulations prohibiting fraudulent conduct. The curr_chunk discusses conforming amendments related to regulations prohibiting fraudulent conduct. The curr_chunk amends Section 15B(c) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 for Municipal Securities Dealers, specifying offenses and actions that would disqualify individuals from proceedings under this section. The curr_chunk amends Section 15C(c)(1) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 for Government Securities Brokers and Dealers, specifying offenses and actions that would disqualify individuals from proceedings under this section. The curr_chunk amends Section 17A(c) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 for Clearing Agencies, specifying offenses and actions that would disqualify individuals from proceedings under this section. The curr_chunk amends Section 3(a)(39) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to include statutory disqualifications related to specific acts or orders listed in subparagraphs (A), (D), (E), (G), or (H) of section 15(b)(4). The curr_chunk amends Section 3(a)(39) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 by updating the reference from "subparagraph (C) of such paragraph (4)" to "section 15(b)(4)(C)". The curr_chunk broadens the penny stock bar. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to broaden the penny stock bar to include noncovered securities. This change also applies to securities offerings. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to broaden the penny stock bar to include noncovered securities in securities offerings. This includes defining terms such as 'noncovered security' and 'participation in an offering of noncovered securities'. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to broaden the penny stock bar to include noncovered securities in securities offerings, defining terms such as 'noncovered security' and 'participation in an offering of noncovered securities'. The definition of 'participation in an offering of noncovered securities' includes activities such as acting as a broker, dealer, or issuer for the issuance or trading of noncovered securities. Court authority to prohibit offerings of noncovered securities. Section 21(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to allow courts to prohibit individuals who violated securities laws from participating in offerings of noncovered securities. The term 'noncovered security' refers to any security not described in specific sections of the Securities Act of 1933. Participation in an offering of noncovered securities includes acting as a promoter, finder, consultant, or agent, engaging in activities with a broker, dealer, or issuer for the issuance or trading of noncovered securities, or inducing the purchase or sale of such securities. The term 'noncovered security' includes activities specified by the Commission and excludes persons or classes exempted by the Commission. SEC. 8 amends Section 21(d)(2) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to broaden officer and director bar. SEC. 9 addresses violations of court-ordered bars. SEC. 9 addresses violations of court-ordered bars by making it unlawful for individuals under such orders to participate in offerings involving noncovered securities in contravention of the order.
